#Text=2008 Dakar Rally cancelled over terrorist threat
#Text=Saturday , January 5 , 2008
#Text=File : Dakar 2006 Hummer Gordon .
#Text=jpg
#Text=A file photo of a Hummer H3 competing in the 2006 event ( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=The threat of terrorism has caused the cancellation yesterday of the 2008 Dakar Rally , due to start today .
#Text=The race , which was to be the 30th consecutive rally , was to start in Lisbon , Portugal and end on January 20 in Dakar , Senegal having crossed the Sahara Desert .

#Text=The endurance event is the world ’s biggest off-road rally and Paris -based organisers Amaury Sport Organisation had said as late as Thursday that more than 500 cars , trucks , motorcycles and quads from fifty different countries were ready to go as scheduled .
#Text=However , the organisation changed its mind under pressure from the French government .
#Text=Al-Qaida
#Text=-linked groups are believed to have planned to attack the rally , and it is reported that specific threats were made against it by al-Qaida in the Islamic Magreb , a regional African offshoot .
#Text=The day before Christmas a French family on holiday in Mauritania was murdered and al-Qaida are believed to be responsible ; the rally was scheduled to spend eight days in Mauritania .
#Text=Al-Qaida in the Islamic Magreb have recently seen a crackdown by authorities , but are continuing their operations and are now seeking to strike international targets .
#Text=Last month they bombed the United Nations headquarters in Algiers ; that attack killed 37 .

#Text=The Mauritanian government had promised a 3,000-strong security force to protect the competitors but the remote location of the desert and scrubland involved would make effective security arrangements almost impossible .

#Text=French security consultant Louis Caprioli , former anti-terrorism head at the Direction de la Surveillance du Territoire , said “ You would need really incredible security precautions , and I do n’t think it ’s possible with the new techniques of attack , such as suicide bombings . ”
#Text=French Foreign Minister Bernard Kouchner said yesterday that Amuary had been warned by government officials that it would be too dangerous to go ahead with the plan .
#Text=After last-minute meetings with ministry officials .
#Text=“ No other decision but the cancellation of the sporting event could be taken , ” said a statement on Amuary ’s website .
#Text=Caprioli said the terrorists intended to prove “ They can chase out the infidels .
#Text=The cancellation was wise .
#Text=But it gives the impression that the terrorists have won . ”
#Text=Patrice Clerc , head of Amuary , stated “ When you are told of direct threats against the event and when the sinister name of al-Qaeda is mentioned , you do n’t ask for details .
#Text=It was enough for me to hear my government say the danger is at a maximum . ”
#Text=Security has caused many concerns for the race over the years .
#Text=Extremists tend to view the race as a prime target , as it is highly covered by the media , and is a rare concentration of Westerners .
#Text=As a result , major security measures have had to be undertaken by French and African authorities .
#Text=Almost 50 people have been killed , several of whom at the hands of African fighters .
#Text=Although there are fears for the future of the race , Amuary said that the event would continue in the future . “ The Dakar is a symbol , and nothing can destroy symbols , ” they said .
#Text=“ The cancellation of the 2008 edition does not endanger the future of the Dakar . ”
#Text=However , they have confirmed that it is unlikely Mauritania will be a destination in future events .
#Text=Competitors in the event , however , are less optimistic , with many saying that they feel the race will not go ahead next year .
#Text=Newspapers in Senegal have described the cancellation as a death sentence .
#Text=Meanwhile , the town of Portimao in Portugal , intended to be the rally ’s first scheduled stop , are considering filing for damages against Amuary .

#Text=Victor Anderes , vice-president of a New York firm specialising in high-profile event security , called the cancellation an unprecedented one in sporting history , saying “ Smaller cultural events have been cancelled , but this has n’t happened with such a major international event . ”
#Text=However , he did accept that “ The threat is significant .
#Text=It would be almost impossible to secure the entire course . ”
